title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 21 December 2011 - XWiki
content:
00:18 <abusenius> has quit  
03:12 <sburjan> has quit  
03:27 <undercoverbob> has quit  
03:29 <undercoverbob> has joined #xwiki  
03:49 <sburjan`> has quit  
03:49 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
04:04 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: shouldn't the czech language be abbreviated as cz instead of cs ?  
04:05 <@sdumitriu> sburjan`: Nope  
04:10 <@sdumitriu> Search for czech on http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List\_of\_ISO\_639-1\_codes  
04:10 <@sdumitriu> cs comes from cestina  
04:10 <@sdumitriu> cz appears in the English name only  
04:15 <+sburjan`> yes, you're right  
06:00 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
06:00 <Denis> has quit  
06:28 <npm\_> is now known as <npm>  
09:02 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
09:10 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:10 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <vmassol> silviar: s/products/projects would be better I think  
09:23 <vmassol> (since this is what we use)  
09:23 <vmassol> (terminology we use I mean)  
09:24 <silviar> vmassol: Hi! ok, so I'll rename the page  
09:24 <vmassol> renaming is ok but you may want to put a redirect  
09:25 <silviar> yes, even better  
09:25 <silviar> thanks!  
09:25 <vmassol> silviar: you should also add XWiki Commons doc in the dev section  
09:25 <vmassol> below XWiki Rendering  
09:26 <silviar> ok  
09:27 <vmassol> I think we talked of adding those 2 in the top level menu with Caty but I don't recall for sure. In any case we need to make XWiki Rendering more visible for sure  
09:27 <vmassol> I'll ping he  
09:27 <vmassol> her  
09:27 <silviar> ok  
09:29 <vmassol> actually not sure  
09:29 <vmassol> they are listed on the "All projects" page  
09:30 <vmassol> I'll leave it like this FTM  
09:30 <silviar> ok  
09:32 <vmassol> silviar: why did you create a ProductsDocumentation page?  
09:32 <vmassol> :)  
09:33 <silviar> I thought you meant adding an "s" at the end of "Products" in ProductDocumentation :) Now i see you meant just Products  
09:34 <vmassol> no  
09:34 <vmassol> "silviar: s/products/projects would be better I think"  
09:34 <vmassol> btw I haven't suggested renaming the page  
09:34 <vmassol> but renaming the content  
09:34 <vmassol> Renaming the page is logical though too  
09:34 <silviar> ok, so replacing products with projects  
09:35 <silviar> got it :)  
09:35 <silviar> (i hope)  
09:37 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <vmassol1> Documentation is nicer IMO (more generic, simpler)  
09:39 <silviar> ok, Documentation it is then with redirect from ProductDocumentation :)  
09:39 <vmassol> has quit  
09:39 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
09:49 <silviar> has quit  
09:49 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <+Denis> sdumitriu: still up ?  
10:06 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
10:06 <+Denis> Any idea why on 3.3 I could get an issue saving XWikiPrefs ?  
10:06 <vmassol> has quit  
10:07 <+Denis> it trhows on a mismatch between Yes and a number  
10:07 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <@sdumitriu> Nope  
10:08 <+Denis> Are you aware on any change there during 3.3 ?N  
10:13 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <@sdumitriu> Denis: Either the database mapping is wrong, or a property changed its type  
10:25 <@sdumitriu> Or another option is that you're using the wrong version of the DB connector  
10:26 <+Denis> what is the correct version ?  
10:26 <+Denis> (I have not change it recently)  
10:30 <undercoverbob> is now known as <tekzilla>  
10:44 <vmassol> has quit  
10:56 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
10:59 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
11:03 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:37 <CIA-115> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r5a22744 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-appwithinminutes/src/main/resources/AppWithinMinutes/ClassEditSheet.xml : XWIKI-7306: The class editor doesn't validate properly the field names - http://git.io/NsFlhg  
11:37 <CIA-115> Marius Dumitru Florea stable-3.3.x \* rb4a3113 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-appwithinminutes/src/main/resources/AppWithinMinutes/ClassEditSheet.xml : XWIKI-7306: The class editor doesn't validate properly the field names ...  
11:44 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Do you have some time for a WYSIWYG change?  
11:45 <+mflorea> depends on how big is the change :)  
11:45 <+mflorea> what do you want to change?  
11:46 <+Denis> sdumitriu: found the issue  
11:46 <@sdumitriu> I'll commit XWIKI-7308 in a few minutes  
11:46 <+mflorea> cool!  
11:46 <@sdumitriu> The problem is that the WYSIWYG applies its own "clear name" when trying to upload an attachment  
11:46 <+Denis> sdumitriu: it is related to the migration of "showhistory" field that is broken  
11:46 <+mflorea> yep  
11:46 <+mflorea> I can drop it  
11:47 <@sdumitriu> So it complains that the attach failed  
11:47 <@sdumitriu> OK, watch for my commit  
11:47 <@sdumitriu> Denis: What migration?  
11:47 <@sdumitriu> That field didn't exist before  
11:47 <+Denis> sdumitriu: there is two issues IMO, the migration does not works, and it occurs on all documents while you save only one  
11:47 <@sdumitriu> Or did someone else touch it besides me?  
11:47 <+mflorea> ok, I should accept any file name, right?  
11:47 <+Denis> sdumitriu: it was documentes  
11:47 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Yes  
11:47 <+Denis> documented  
11:48 <+mflorea> ok, thanks  
11:48 <+Denis> and it was a string  
11:48 <+Denis> what is happening to me, is that we have created as a string in 2.4  
11:49 <+Denis> then we have imported a space from 2.4, with a WebPrefs in it  
11:49 <CIA-115> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rcc9c86f / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7308: Allow special (and Asian) characters in attachments ...  
11:49 <CIA-115> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* ra44dc57 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/util/Util.java : [misc] Wrong regular expression used for validating xclass property names - http://git.io/RsGAOA  
11:49 <+Denis> and when we save XWiki.XWikiPrefs, it tries to convert myspace.WebPrefs !  
11:49 <+Denis> and it fails doing a new Integer("yes")  
11:50 <@sdumitriu> Denis: True  
11:50 <+Denis> so anyone who have created such properties in the past, and import any webprefs, will face the issue  
11:51 <+Denis> this is really bad  
11:51 <@sdumitriu> If you edit the XWikiPreferences document in object mode, do you have a warning about "deprecated properties"?  
11:51 <+Denis> since it broke XWiki.XWikiPrefs and you really do not catch that it was cause by another document  
11:51 <@sdumitriu> Hm, actually that might not work, since you can't import the new class at all  
11:51 <+Denis> XWikiPrefs is not imported !  
11:51 <@sdumitriu> Try to delete those properties first  
11:55 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <risherry> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <vmassol> test  
11:55 <vmassol> ok  
11:55 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:56 <vmassol> silviar: don't know if you've seen my message above: "the screenshot is missing the bottom tabs: http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GettingStarted/WebHome"  
11:57 <silviar> vmassol: I've just seen it; will add another image that has the tabs; thanks!  
11:57 <vmassol> we might want to add highlights or search, panels too, unless we think it's too much  
11:58 <vmassol> s/or/on/  
11:58 <risherry> has left #xwiki  
12:02 <vmassol> sburjan`: FF9 final is out it seems, you'll need to plan a test session for 3.4 ASAP on it  
12:02 <sdumitriu> has quit  
12:23 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:46 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
12:48 <vmassol> has quit  
12:58 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
12:59 <+sburjan> hello vmassol1 . Yes, I know about FF9, I will test on it  
13:01 <+sburjan> I want to test App Within minutes first  
13:05 <vmassol1> ok  
13:08 <CIA-115> tmortagne feature-extension-versions \* rcec8159 / (8 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-7240: Add support for special versions qualifiers and version ranges ...  
13:10 <+sburjan> more exactly, App WIthin minutes on IE browsers  
13:12 <tmortagne> has quit  
13:13 <CIA-115> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* ra90e49e / (3 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7308: Allow special (and Asian) characters in attachments ...  
13:16 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:16 <vmassol1> has quit  
13:34 <vmassol> going to travel back home, will be back in a few hours  
13:36 <vmassol> has quit  
14:04 <mflorea> has quit  
15:08 <CIA-115> has quit  
15:08 <CIA-114> has joined #xwiki  
15:12 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:43 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
17:01 <sburjan`> has quit  
17:27 <ramongb> has joined #xwiki  
17:38 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:41 <ramongb> Hi everybody, hi vmassol, last week I've contacted you guys for some help with a problem migrating from XE 3.1 to 3.3, with postgresql. It seems that the data model had not been migrated in this new version. Since this problem will only be available on the next correction release, you offered some help to assist me solving this error on my instance  
17:41 <ramongb> the bug is the very same as http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1037  
17:44 <vmassol> has quit  
17:45 <ramongb> Last week we could not proceed on this, due to the 3.3 release. If you could give me some help solving this before the next minor release, I would really appreciate.  
17:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:45 <vmassol> ramongb: hi  
17:45 <vmassol> Actually I've tested postgresql in the meantime  
17:45 <vmassol> version 9.1  
17:45 <vmassol> and I've found it to work quite well (I was surprised :))  
17:45 <vmassol> We have 2 functional tests failing though that I haven't analyzed yet  
17:46 <vmassol> I haven't tested the upgrade path though  
17:46 <vmassol> but starting clean with a 3.3 on postgresql 9.1 worked fine for me  
17:52 <ramongb> starting clean should really work without problems, I believe. But the case is migrating from 3.1 to 3.3. I'm using Jboss 4.2.3 and Postgres 8.3. Since I have a long term production environment since xe 3.0, with tons of pages and data, starting clean is not the case, unfortunately. When starting the instance, it triggers an exception "org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: Bad value for type long : <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?  
17:52 <ramongb> precisely on com.xpn.xwiki.doc.rcs.XWikiRCSNodeContent  
17:53 <ramongb> any xe version starting on 3.2 fails on migration with postgresql  
17:56 <vmassol> ramongb: I don't have a solution out of the box. The way I solve these kinds of things is by googling usually and then adjusting the xwiki.hbm.xml file accordingly  
17:56 <vmassol> I'll try to spend some time on it in the future but I'm on holidays next week so I won't be help to do much till next year (10 days from now)  
18:00 <ramongb> Sorry if I bother you with this too much, and of course I'll get some holidays too :) I would like to help as much as I can, I can't just figure out where I can start looking at the xwiki.hbm.xml  
18:03 <ramongb> But absolutely no problem, vmassol. Thanks in advance all the help, I'll do some research as well, and maybe we can take a look on this after holidays.  
18:05 <vmassol> ramongb: you need to verify the type generated by hibernate in postgresql  
18:05 <vmassol> then check why it's a problem  
18:05 <vmassol> then try to adjust the xwiki.hbm.xml file  
18:05 <vmassol> you can find this file in the \*oldcore\* jar in your WEB-INF/lib  
18:06 <vmassol> you can extract it and put it in WEB-INF/classes and modify it  
18:06 <ramongb> nice, i was in the right path, I've done that. I'll check the types  
18:07 <vmassol> ok  
18:08 <ramongb> thanks again for the help, wish you good holidays  
18:11 <vmassol> thanks. I'm still connected for a few hours here if you have questions  
18:13 <vmassol> ramongb: what you could do is check the differences  
18:13 <vmassol> between xwiki.hbm.xml in version 3.1 and in 3.3  
18:13 <vmassol> hibernate performs a schema update and maybe there's something it doesn't support with postgre  
18:14 <vmassol> latest version is here: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/resources/xwiki.hbm.xml  
18:16 <vmassol> history: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commits/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/resources/xwiki.hbm.xml  
18:21 <ramongb> vmassol: nice, I'll check this in detail  
18:21 <vmassol> XE 3.1 was released 21 June 2011  
18:21 <vmassol> so we can see in the history what was modified  
18:22 <ramongb> upgrades done from xe 2.7 to 3.1 were successfull, in my various instances, as far as I remember  
18:25 <vmassol> only change I can see is  
18:25 <vmassol> -            <property name="language" column="XDD\_LANGUAGE" type="string" length="5" />  
18:25 <vmassol> -            <property name="date" type="timestamp" column="XDD\_DATE" />  
18:25 <vmassol> +            <property name="language" column="XDD\_LANGUAGE" type="string" length="5" index="XDD\_LANGUAGE" />  
18:25 <vmassol> +            <property name="date" type="timestamp" column="XDD\_DATE" index="XDD\_DATE" />  
18:25 <vmassol> ie the index addition  
18:27 <vmassol> google gives a lot of info  
18:28 <vmassol> for ex: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2069541/postgresql-jdbc-and-streaming-blobs  
18:29 <vmassol> this is interesting too: http://www.artin.org/geekblog/2011/01/hibernate-3-6-0-final-postgresql-clobs/  
18:29 <vmassol> ahah  
18:29 <vmassol> "Ultimately I found a simple solution.  PostgreSQL apparently doesn’t play well with Hibernate 3.6 and requires a specific Hibernate annotation on your entity (I’m using JPA entities by the way).  On your CLOB, in addition to the @Lob, add:"  
18:29 <vmassol> @Type(type="org.hibernate.type.StringClobType")  
18:29 <vmassol> I know how to do this  
18:30 <vmassol> so here's what you can try ramongb:  
18:30 <vmassol> edit the xwiki.hbm.xml file and add the following before the first <class name  
18:30 <vmassol> <typedef name="materialized\_clob" class="org.hibernate.type.StringClobType" />  
18:31 <vmassol> that should fix the issue I believe  
18:31 <ramongb> hhhmmmm  
18:31 <vmassol> let me know how it goes  
18:31 <vmassol> we have the same "trick" for Oracle  
18:31 <vmassol> (you can check xwiki.oracle.hbm.xml if you wish)  
18:32 <ramongb> nice, I'll do it and I'll let you know  
18:32 <ramongb> yep, I've followed the discussions about oracle  
18:33 <ramongb> it's just a thought, but I believe the problem is with the docId property from table xwikircs, from class XWikiRCSNodeContent  
18:34 <vmassol> I don't think so  
18:34 <vmassol> I think it's with the content property of that table  
18:34 <vmassol> since this is what is in the stack trace :)  
18:34 <vmassol> here: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-1037  
18:34 <vmassol> the xml goes in the content part  
18:34 <vmassol> not in the doc id  
18:35 <vmassol> the fact that the docid type is "long" is coincidental IMO  
18:36 <vmassol> http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2069541/postgresql-jdbc-and-streaming-blobs explains the long issue AFAIU  
18:36 <vmassol> "Large binary objects are stored indirecty with OID columns in Postgres."  
18:36 <vmassol> "The actual file data is stored somewhere outside the database table by Postgres. The column just contains an object identifier that is associated internally with the blob."  
18:36 <ramongb> as I said, It was just a thought :) (probably wrong, btw). I thought it might be wrongly loading a wrong property as docId from the xml content of the page  
18:37 <vmassol> well try it and we'll know  if it works :)  
18:38 <silviar> has quit  
18:39 <ramongb> very nice vmassol, thanks again for your help, I'll give it a try a bit later and let you know. I wish you and your family (and all the XWiki Team, as well) Merry Christmas and a happy new year, and more success for our prefeered X toll  
18:39 <ramongb> uppss... Xwiki Tool  
18:39 <ramongb> :)  
18:39 <vmassol> thanks :) you too  
18:39 <ramongb> Greetings from Brazil  
18:41 <vmassol> nice  
18:50 <ramongb> vmassol, just another unrelated question: is there any sample code of the xwiki.org main page skin (i think some new global.vm code), and css as well, that shows how the mouse-over top menus were implemented? the navigation is more suitable than a panel, with the menus just below the header logo  
18:51 <vmassol> !search horizontal menu  
18:51 <vmassol> ramongb: you could check this extension: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Navigation+Menu+Wiki+Macro  
18:52 <vmassol> I don't know if it does what you need  
18:52 <vmassol> otherwise you can check how it's done on xwiki.org  
18:53 <vmassol> xwiki.org is not feeling too well right now… it's damn slow  
18:55 <ramongb> I think it's something on this way, like the Home, About Xwiki, Projects etc menus on xwiki.org  
18:55 <vmassol> restarting xwiki.org now
